algorithm_technique: Greedy approach similar to Jump Game II
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum taps to water a garden of length n.
problem_summary_technical: Transforms the problem into a Jump Game II variant on an interval coverage array.
key_insights: The problem can be reframed as finding the minimum number of intervals to cover [0, n].
Each tap's range is converted into a start and end point, and then mapped to an array representing the maximum reach from each starting point.
A greedy strategy, similar to Jump Game II, is used to select the next tap that extends the coverage the furthest.
